column2: Litvaks stress highly intellectual Talmud study through yeshivas. They descend from earlier opponents to the Chassidic movent known as the Misnagdim, who were centered around the area of Greater Lithuania.

Breslover Chassids follow the teachings of Rebbe Nachman of Breslov, who stressed building a personal connection with God and advocated for Kiruv (outreach to non-Haredi Jews). He left no successor and encouraged his followers to remain decentralized.
Porat Yosef was the first Sepharadi Haredi Yeshiva, and the Rabbis who taught there shaped a new uniquely Sepharadi tradition of Haredi Judaism.

The Chassidic movement developed in Eastern Europe beginning with the Baal Shem Tov. Chassids follow one of many rabbinical courts, each run by a Rebbe of a given dynasty who guides his followers in all their life decisions and whose position is passed down from father to son.
I can change which Haredi movement that I belong to
As a pious Ivri you can restore the Chief Rabbi Office in Jerusalem...

I find myself distanced from the community I was raised in. The teachings I once valued no longer hold the same meaning. While it might cause scandal, I can choose to join another Haredi community, but which teachings should I choose to follow?
I will follow the teachings of the Vilna Gaon and the Litvaks
I will follow the teachings of the Baal Shem Tov and the Chassidim
I will follow the teachings of Nachman of Breslov and the Breslover Chassidim
I will follow the teachings of the rabbis of Porat Yosef
The Haredi Community is outraged by the actions of this individual.
A renowned scholar-king, who unified the squabbling [sabra.GetName] and [filastini.GetName] tribes, While his Kingdom is no more, his descendants are well-respected scholars and theologians.
